description:
A vocabulary for representing latitude, longitude and altitude information in the WGS84 geodetic reference datum.  WGS stands for the World Geodetic Survey.

Version: 1.22.0

Point.label: point
Point.description: Uniquely identified by lat/long/alt. i.e.spaciallyIntersects(P1, P2) :- lat(P1, LAT), long(P1, LONG), alt(P1, ALT),  lat(P2, LAT), long(P2, LONG), alt(P2, ALT).sameThing(P1, P2) :- type(P1, Point), type(P2, Point), spaciallyIntersects(P1, P2).

SpatialThing.label: SpatialThing
SpatialThing.description: Anything with spatial extent, i.e. size, shape, or position. e.g. people, places, bowling balls, as well as abstract areas like cubes.

alt.label: altitude
alt.description: The WGS84 altitude of a SpatialThing (decimal meters above the local reference ellipsoid).

lat.label: latitude
lat.description: The WGS84 latitude of a SpatialThing (decimal degrees).

lat_long.label: lat/long
lat_long.description: A comma-separated representation of a latitude, longitude coordinate.

location.label: location
location.description: The relation between something and the point,  or other geometrical thing in space, where it is.  For example, the realtionship between a radio tower and a Point with a given lat and long. Or a relationship between a park and its outline as a closed arc of points, or a road and its location as a arc (a sequence of points). Clearly in practice there will be limit to the accuracy of any such statement, but one would expect an accuracy appropriate for the size of the object and uses such as mapping .

long.label: longitude
long.description: The WGS84 longitude of a SpatialThing (decimal degrees).
